contentrichtext.text: '''This page is an archive of the discussion surrounding the proposed deletion of the page entitled [[Immortality Institute]].''' '''This page is kept as an historic record.''' '''The result of the debate was to delete the article.''' ---- Delete. This is a very small organisation that happens to have 80 members (see [[Bruce Klein]], its founder, right above) and can afford a web page. There must be lots of similar groups around, and this one is not more encyclopedic than any others. This material can be moved to [[cryonics]] or other pages which deal with subjects related to ImmInst's ideology and methodology. [[User:Jfdwolff|JFW]] | [[User_talk:Jfdwolff|<small>T@lk</small>]] 11:47, 16 May 2004 (UTC) * Delete. This is too much of a vanity article to be moved to cryonics. [[User:AlainV|AlainV]] 21:21, 2004 May 16 (UTC) * It's an ad. Delete. -- [[User:Cyrius|Cyrius]]|[[User talk:Cyrius|&#9998]] 22:21, May 16, 2004 (UTC) *Delete: advert, nonnotable. [[User:Wile E. Heresiarch|Wile E. Heresiarch]] 13:48, 17 May 2004 (UTC) *keep: It's a unique site, there are no other sites which target is the same. It contains a lot of information related to healthy life extension, which can't be found in no other single place. ---- This page is now preserved as an archive of the debate and is no longer 'live'. Subsequent comments on the issue or the deletion should be placed on other relevant 'live' pages. '''Please do not edit this page.''' ----
